text: I got a 2020 Honda CR-V a few weeks ago. First vehicle I've had with Android Auto support (or Car Play but I haven't owned a iPhone since the iPhone 4, just personal preference).Anyways when I first got it I couldn't not get Android Auto to work. I tried everything I could find online about the problem and you can find plenty of people that have/had trouble getting it to work in their Honda CR-V (ironic since the infotainment system runs on android). Tried doing a full factory reset on the infotainment system, turning on USB debugging in dev settings, and the 2 dif USB type C to USB type A cable I had. No matter it would not work. My phone would charge when plugged in but that's it. A message is supposed to pop up on the infotainment system asking if you want to enable android auto.I bought this cable as a last resort. I made sure to get a USB 2.0 and NOT a USB 3.0 type C to USB type A cable. Didn't think it would make a difference. Got in the car, turned it on, plugged the cable into the car, then into my phone, and BAM the "do you want to enable android auto" message instantly pops up on the infotainment system. And it works perfectly. Love it.
title: Couldn't get Android Auto to work in my new car, this cable did the trick!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 17, 2023

text: I recently purchased the Amazon Basics USB A to USB C cable and wanted to share my experience with fellow shoppers. Overall, the cable does its job well, but there are a few aspects worth mentioning.First, let's talk about the positives. The cable functions reliably and effectively connects my USB A devices to my USB C devices. I haven't experienced any connectivity issues or data transfer problems so far, which is crucial when it comes to cables.However, one notable drawback of this cable is its stiff jacket. The cable's outer covering feels rigid and inflexible, making it a bit challenging to maneuver and position as desired. Although this stiffness can be attributed to the cable's durability, it may be a point of concern for those seeking a more flexible and pliable option.That being said, if you're primarily looking for a durable cable that can withstand some wear and tear, this might be a suitable choice for you. The cable's build quality appears to be solid, and it feels sturdy enough to last for an extended period. Just keep in mind that the trade-off for this durability is the cable's rigidity.
title: Reliable Cable with Stiff Jacket
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 2, 2023

text: Maybe it worked a little TOO well, maybe it was user error and I wasn't supposed to use it on my earbud case--I don't know. All I know is that I bought this charger as a temporary replacement for my earbud case since the original charger stopped working (and ironically, the charger cables on the official brand site are completely sold out, hence turning to Amazon for a generic one). I have an older, nearly falling apart version of the earbuds that uses a different charger type, and I charge it with a generic charging cable--I haven't had a problem in the 2 years I've been using it. Hence my optimism doing the same for the new earbuds. I opened it as soon as it arrived and everything seemed great. I plugged it into my case and it charged just fine; in fact, it was just what I needed at the start. Cue a couple hours later.I unplugged the case, as it was fully charged, and was using my earbuds when all of a sudden--after about an hour of it being unplugged--there was a LOUD pop, sparks flew out of the case, and it began to smoke. I hurried and disposed of the case because obviously, but was confused because HOW??? The only reasons that come to mind is that the charger and earbud case just weren't compatible or I was sent a faulty charging cable. I don't know, I'm not a battery expert, but I DO know that lithium batteries aren't supposed to randomly explode within an hour of charging them. Just exercise EXTREME caution and monitor your devices if you do decide to purchases this charger, because no one wants lithium batteries to randomly explode in their house.
title: Could potentially cause your lithium battery to explode
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023

text: The description says it will work with “any Type-C enabled device”. Maybe I’m just misunderstanding what “any Type-C enabled device” actually is. I would like a longer charging cable for my iPad Pro and I gambled, since it says it will work with another Apple product, (the MacBook), and lost. The cable might just as well be a piece of string with usb plugs. There is no response of any kind when I plug it in. Even an off brand lightning cable will say “this device may not work with this cable “. Returning it would just be more trouble than it’s worth. Giving it two stars is working on the assumption that it may actually work on “any Type-C enabled device”... except the iPad Pro! So, be careful and don’t get your hopes up. Especially if you want to use it for an Apple product.To be fair I could not find anywhere it said it WOULD work with the iPad Pro. 🌟🌟UPDATE: I does work! The charging cable that came with the iPad is instantly recognized so when I plugged the new one in and it didn’t immediately work I made the mistaken assumption that my new iPad just wouldn’t recognize this Non-Apple cord. It actually takes about 7-8 seconds to wake up and begin charging with this generic cable.So, 7 seconds is just fine with me and assuming it won’t burn out like the old Lightning cables did.I couldn’t be happier.If you found my review helpful, please let Amazon know by clicking the helpful button below!
title: It might just as well be a piece of string with usb plugs! UPDATED POSITIVE REVIEW!

text: Amazon Basics USB Type-C to USB-A 2.0 Male Charger Cable, 3 Feet (0.9 Meters), White. These 3-foot white USB Type-C to USB-A 2.0 Male charger cables can connect USB-C enabled devices (MacBook, Chromebook Pixel, Galaxy Note 7, etc.) with standard USB-A enabled devices (laptops, hard drives, power banks, wall/car chargers, etc.). They are handy for charging, powering USB-C enabled devices, as well as syncing data, photos, and music. They boast up to 480 Mbps data transfer speed; power output up to 5V, 3 Amp.  They are reversible; the user can easily insert the Type-C connector into any Type-C enabled device (does not matter which side is up). And they are certified by USB-IF to be compliant with USB 2.0 Standard.Well, these are handy things to have  around in a world where they are frequently misplaced. Was once talking to a hotel maid who remarked that she often found them under beds, etc.  I lose them occasionally, usually at high-stress moments when  they’re really needed.  Glad to have a few. text: Amazon basic brand is my go to brand for electronic accessories for its vetted quality. Bought 6 foot cord already and now buying more to lay around the house at my desk, sofa, recliner, and in my car. Easier than carrying one set of cords around. Found the 10 foot cord was too long which reduces charging speed, especially when paired up with lower mAh charger, or does not power the device at all. Pair a 10 footer only if you have a high capacity charger. Forget about QI wireless charging which have a higher charging demand. Disadvantage of using cords with plastic type covers vs braided type covers is that they are easier to tangle and inserts wrinkles went tightly wrapped and folded in. I installed a Velcro cord wrap you can buy at a home improvement store to avoid wrinkles when wrapping and storing the cord. The connector tip do break off if you step on them.

text:
I recently got a new phone that uses a USB Type-C charger. All of my other devices used a micro USB, so I suddenly found myself without any spare USB cables that would work for my phone. This AmazonBasics cord, which has a USB Type-C on one end and USB-A on the other, works perfectly for me to charge my phone using my computer at work. It also works well with the 
  
AmazonBasics 60W 6-Port USB Charger - Black







  
  
    , which is what I use to charge all my devices overnight. The 6-foot cord gives ample room to move around while the phone is charging. I will say the charging speeds don't compare to the official Google charger that came with my Pixel, but as I'm basically using this as a backup charger, anyway, it's not a big deal.I have had one problem, and I don't know if it's computer or cord related: The first time I plugged this into my computer, my screen immediately snapped to thin, colorful, horizontal lines. My music kept playing in the background, but the screen was useless. I had to force shut down, and when I restarted, everything was fine. I've used the cord (in the same port on the same computer) multiple times since then with no trouble, but I thought it was worth mentioning.
title: Good back-up cord for USB Type-C devices

text: USB C cables for charging, and even not so, are active cables, they have a chip in them that allows it recognize its position and what it can do.  So, I am very skeptical about $1 USB-C cables, not just that it would work, but continue to work after purchase and not destroy your gadget now or later.  Given the cost of the gadget,  and that cables last over the useful life of the gadget, getting a brand name I can hold accountable is better if not formally USB C certified.ProsI tested these cables using a Ruideng 25C and my phones Turbo Charger QC 2.0 mode.  The cable allowed current to 2.4A, as rated, and engaged the QC 2.0 mode, and works bidirectionally, as expected.  I used the cable for charging for over 1 week then installed it to charge a mounted phone on my car, but charging is only non-turbo modeQuality build by reputable brand, braided firm materialNo Cons

I tested the controller by playing with it for a couple of days while not plugged in, and the battery level in the system didn't appear to go down any, so I couldn't judge exactly how fast this cable charges, but it charged it well enough for my use because the level has stayed full during my uses.Overall, I didn't find any flaws in using this Amazon Basics USB C cable with my Nintendo Switch Pro controller and highly recommend it for that application.  5/5 stars

text: works really well. More versatile than standard USB-C cables as these can be plugged into the more common USB "A" found on computers and most phone chargers.  This eliminates the need for me to carry a separate USB-C charger when travelling.NOTE that it will not charge as quickly as a standard USB-C charger with a USB-C cable, but charges quickly enough.Using the "AMPERE" phone app, the attached pics show that the AMPERE app measuring the charging of an ALMOST fully charged LG Nexus 5X phone charging at the max rate of 400 mAh with the LG Charger and OEM LG USB-C cable.The other picture showing the max charging rate of 340 mAh is with the Amazon USB-A=> USB-C and a OLYTEK travel charging using the standard USB-A outlet.  So, the AMAZON cable is charging about 85% as quickly as the OEM LG USB-c charger and cable.NOTE 2= when a phone is mostly charged, the charging rate slows down.  If the phone's battery was used up the rates would be much higher.Seems to be of very high quality and the white cables make them easy to locate in a bag.
title: Works well, well made; charges quickly

text: I probably own more than my fair share of devices that use USB cables, and I've either lost or broken a number of cables over the years.  Cheap USB cables are available everywhere, of course, but cables that last can be harder to find.  This cable, which I bought to charge my new smartphone in my car, is The Good Stuff at a better-than-average price.  Let me tell you, it's gone through a lot in the months that I've been using it -- getting jerked out of USB sockets, stepped on, pulled out from under whatever I toss into the passenger seat, etc. -- and it keeps on working well.I don't know who makes Amazon Basics cables, but I have yet to have an Amazon Basics cable break or fail in over two years of using this brand.  I trust them enough that I've since begun buying other Amazon Basics products, including two camera bags for my growing DSLR-photography hobby.

text: I have had these cables before, and I do like the Amazon Basics line of goods in general.These are hearty in the way they are made, and last a lot longer than any other cords I've owned.However, the one draw back is their rigidity, they don't bend or flex easily. If you hold your phone while its plugged in, it will continually drop the cable on you. The rigidity doesn't allow the cable to bend as you move, and forces the connector to flex back and forth making it wiggle out of the port.I have one of these in my car, wired into the dash and comes out at the phone mount. The setup is static and the wire doesn't wiggle free. So, for that setup its perfect.  But I have another loose wire in the cab for the passenger, and you have to hold the cable to keep it from coming out.I also use another for connecting a laptop to my network. Its fine because it doesn't move and wiggle out.

text: Not the best of the Amazonbasics cables i've used.  Bought it as a secondary cable for use in my car.  Whenever I plug it into my cell phone (ZTE MAX) the phone continually "dings" on and off because the cable is very loose in the USB C port.  The OEM cable does not cause this to happen, neither does the OEM cable from a Samsung phone I have.I  have several of this brand of charger cable for my Apple products, both with the 30 pin connector and the lightning connector, and always recommend them over any other brand including Apple's branded cables, as these have worked just as good for a fraction of the price, and honestly, have lasted longer than the Apple OEM ones. Which makes me think that this is just an isolated issue.I did not return it because if I use it as a desktop charger, where it's not moving in the vehicle, it does not chime on and off all to often.  I assuming that its because it's stationary and the plug is not wiggling around.I would still recommend buying Amazonbasics cables over the OEM for any manufacturer, and especially over the 100's of non OEM brands from any retailer, as they not only cost more, but in my experciance are subpar, and not orth buying even at 1/2 the cost of the Amazon basics.

text: This is a slow USB 2.0 cable, meant primarily for charging, but this is expected. The cable itself is stiffer that I'd have liked, but it is very hard to find a soft cable these days, even for cables with fewer required wires, such as USB 2.0 cables, with only four wires.I compared several A-to-C charging cables that I know, using the same phone, the same Anker charger. This cable delivered the lowest current to the phone (slowest to charge). The Type-C connector is of low quality. When inserted, it feels like it scratches the internals of the phone port, it is nothing like the original, high-quality connectors from LG, Google or Apple with their smooth but secure click feel.On top of that, Amazon shipped a single cable while I ordered two. The one that got shipped was a used cable in a resealed box. There was a visible traces of a sharp bend near the larger connector.The cable works, but I will not buy it again and do not recommend it.

text: Item itself is excellent for those looking for a reliable charging cable. Bonus, they are USB-IF certified.Build quality is acceptable, but I did expect more from an amazon basic product.  The charger cable feels solid and smooth (no rough edges).  Purchased this set as it was highly touted by reviews.  However, you can see from the images I included that the plastic sleeve covering the USB C end can slip if not enough pressure is applied when unplugging your devices. When I unplugged my phone after charging it one day, the metal piece that plugs into my phone broke off the cord and got stuck inside the phone, where it remains stuck to this day. My phone now only charges using a wireless charger. This means I can no longer charge it using a portable charger, which I relied on while traveling, and I also cannot use a car charger. It really bothers me that Amazon sells a piece of equipment that is so poorly made, it can potentially ruin an electronic device's charging port. I'm lucky that wireless charging is an option, because there is no way I would have been able to afford an entirely new phone due to a destroyed charger port.

text: USB C devices are beginning to pop up more and more.  Apple Macbook Pros only have USB C , Sony Xperia Phones, even the Nintendo Switch all use USB C. The connector is reversible, allowing you to not having to worry about orientation of the cable before you plug in which is a nice feature.  There are others, but the truth is many USB C to USB A cables are not manufactured correctly resulting in fried devices.  This is scary.  Don’t use a USB C cable that doesn’t have any good reviews.  Amazon Basics have provided many years of decent cables…how does this USB C one hold up?It seems well made, and in line with the other line of cables. We get  black glossy plastic on the connector ends, and a glossy sleeve around the cable itself.  Gold plated connectors. The USB C connector is thin enough to clear the Orzly TPU case on my Xperia X Compact which is appreciated. I tried data transfer which seemed fine but didn’t have the opportunity to check speeds.  The charging capability was where I was concerned about.  Compared to my pack in Sony cable and some good quality ones from Cable Matters, I noticed the Basics cable seemed to charge at a slightly slower rate than those two.  I would get 1400-1500mA (Ampere app )charging through a Qualcom 3.0 charger compared to 2200+ on the other cables.  Results with a standard charger were similar max speeds on both, and a low speed charger also was okay with 750-850mA for either.  If you charge with a regular charger the cable seems to be fine.  I would not use a Quick Charge charger with it though.  The cable has held up well these past three weeks, but time will really tell if it holds up over time. If the cable fails, I will update this review.I give it a 4 out of 5 for now, based on the fact that it did fine in regular charging, but not for Quick Charging.
title: Decent Cable, not for Quick Charge 2.0 or 3.0 though

text: This 6 ft., USB Type C to USB A 2.0 Male Cable from AmazonBasics appears to be a well made, sturdy cable that functions well.The cable itself is fairly thick and the non-tangling variety. There is a thick collar at the point where it connects to the plastic case that hold the USB connectors. I look for the collar because that is the point where most cables fail after repeated use and the collars serve to protect the wires from breakage from bending.One important thing to note is that the metal, USB C connector shows no seam on either side. It is one, seamless piece of metal. That is a sign of a higher quality cable and something to look for when trying to make sure you don't get a cable that is inferior and could potentially fry your devices. The USB A connector does have a visible seam but I have never seen one that doesn't.Another thing to look for is that the cable is USB-IF certified. Since that this writing, there is no Amazon product page available yet and there is nothing on the box to indicated that this cable is USB-IF certified, I went to usb dot org to check their list of USB-IF certified cables and this cable is on the list. I hope that Amazon makes that clear when they put up a product page and that they will begin to list this certification on the product box.It works great with my son's Nexus 6P phone for charging.If you need a long, USB C to USB A cable, this is a safe, quality cable.
title: Works with Nexus 6P phone

text: AmazonBasics, for anyone not acquainted, are products like cases, microfiber cleaning cloths and cables, produced with quality construction and materials, with minimal package glitz and waste but at a consumer friendly price. I recently bought an Android phone and an Android tablet that both use this newer USB C to Male USB A type plug. I personally love this new standard since there is no flipping and frustration trying to figure out which alignment is correct, and even possible damage while trying to force the plug in the wrong way while in a mental fog. This Basics cord seems to work as well as the original Sony and Google cords my devices shipped with and there has been no, "slow charging detected" warning given as when some lower end cords are used. In comparing them with the OEM cords side by side, the cable part themselves seem to be identical. The apparent difference is the housings surrounding the end plugs which are a shiny plastic build as opposed to the softer feeling OEMs and they're also are not quite as substantial as the original products bulk-wise. Using other Basics cables over time in the past, for example to connect my phone to the charger in the car when driving with the Waze GPS app on, the cable needed to be unplugged and reinserted at least twice each day for my daily work commute and after a year of use, still work perfectly and without damage or wear. So the slightly lighter construction seems to still have served it's purpose and function. This cable though costs about half what the OEM's ask on their web sites for the same length, so I opted to save some money with no apparent lose of function, based on previous experience with Basics cables. If you're especially rough with cables, yanking them impatiently for example, you might opt to pay more for OEMs which might be a little more forgiving. But so far for me, extremely happy with all the AmazonBasics products I've gotten the past few years and appreciate the minimal packaging waste they generate as well. Highly recommended.
title: Quality cables with substantial savings over OEM equivalents, and with minimal packaging waste as well.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 8, 2017

text: For the price point the fit and finish of this cable is good and connectors fit just right. Because it is an AmazonBasic it is priced to undercut the similar cords you'll find at The Shack or Big Box stores.  No surprise that it works for power for new USB C phones, but it is also perfect for data exchange.  As this is my first C-type USB cord I'll admit that perhaps all C-types work flawlessly with data.  However I have amount my cable selection some USB 2 cables that my older Samsung phone would balk at data even as they would work fine as a charging cable.  Anyway this cable is basic but it certainly does what one needs such a cable to do.  I particularly like the longer length of this cable as sometimes a 3-ft cable just won't cut it comfortably.
title: Basic Type-C USB Cable Provides Decent Value & Functionality

text: AmazonBasics, for anyone not acquainted, are products like cases, microfiber cleaning cloths and cables, produced with quality construction and materials, with minimal package glitz and waste but at a consumer friendly price. I recently bought an Android phone and an Android tablet that both use this newer USB C to Male USB A type plug. I personally love this new standard since there is no flipping and frustration trying to figure out which alignment is correct, and even possible damage while trying to force the plug in the wrong way while in a mental fog. This Basics cord seems to work as well as the original Sony and Google cords my devices shipped with and there has been no, "slow charging detected" warning given as when some lower end cords are used. In comparing them with the OEM cords side by side, the cable part themselves seem to be identical. The apparent difference is the housings surrounding the end plugs which are a shiny plastic build as opposed to the softer feeling OEMs and they're also are not quite as substantial as the original products bulk-wise. Using other Basics cables over time in the past, for example to connect my phone to the charger in the car when driving with the Waze GPS app on, the cable needed to be unplugged and reinserted at least twice each day for my daily work commute and after a year of use, still work perfectly and without damage or wear. So the slightly lighter construction seems to still have served it's purpose and function. This cable though costs about half what the OEM's ask on their web sites for the same length, so I opted to save some money with no apparent lose of function, based on previous experience with Basics cables. If you're especially rough with cables, yanking them impatiently for example, you might opt to pay more for OEMs which might be a little more forgiving. But so far for me, extremely happy with all the AmazonBasics products I've gotten the past few years and appreciate the minimal packaging waste they generate as well. Highly recommended.
title: Great quality at a substantial savings over OEM replacement cables and also minimal packaging waste.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 8, 2017

text: This 3 ft., white, USB Type C to USB A 2.0 Male Cable from AmazonBasics appears to be a well made, sturdy cable that functions well.The cable itself is fairly thick and the non-tangling variety. There is a thick collar at the point where it connects to the plastic case that hold the USB connectors. I look for the collar because that is the point where most cables fail after repeated use and the collars serve to protect the wires from breakage from bending.One important thing to note is that the metal, USB C connector shows no seam on either side. It is one, seamless piece of metal. That is a sign of a higher quality cable and something to look for when trying to make sure you don't get a cable that is inferior and could potentially fry your devices. The USB A connector does have a visible seam but I have never seen one that doesn't.Another thing to look for is that the cable is USB-IF certified. Since that this writing, there is no Amazon product page available yet and there is nothing on the box to indicated that this cable is USB-IF certified, I went to usb dot org to check their list of USB-IF certified cables and this cable is on the list. I hope that Amazon makes that clear when they put up a product page and that they will begin to list this certification on the product box.It works great with my son's Nexus 6P phone for charging.If you need a long, USB C to USB A cable, this is a safe, quality cable.
title: Good quality USB C to USB A charging cable

text:
Out of the box, the cable is thick and heavy, with a high quality sheath that is not too stiff. The cable is also well reinforced around the joints with the connectors, so that it is protected from bending/pulling, a frequent point of failure for charging cables. The connector housing is of high quality black piano finish plastic. The type C end is uni-body without seams. Both ends fit very snugly but not overly so.While testing, in spite of the generous length, my LG G5 was able to quick charge at factory specs as measured by USB electrical meter, at 8V and 1.87A. The description doesn't say it is QuickCharge compatible, but the apparently thick gauged cable had no issues with the high voltage and current, even beyond the stated specifications.Data connections presented no issues either, though the only caveat is that it is clearly marked as a USB 2.0 cable, so USB 3.0 SuperSpeed isn't available. Amazon Basics does have USB 3.0 Type C cables though at much shorter lengths. 
  
AmazonBasics USB Type-C to USB-A Male 3.1 Gen2 Cable - 3 Feet  (0.9 Meters) - Black







  
  
    While it doesn't offer popular frills like braided cables or metallic housing, those are really not essential. I personally find braided difficult to clean, and offers questionable durability benefits. It has got where it counts: reliable data transmission, quick high current high voltage charging, generous length, durability measures in its design, and high quality materials. It's a high quality cable, for a very reasonable price.
title: Can QuickCharge. No frills High Quality Cable, Generous Length. Got it where it counts, at a Very Reasonable Price

Charging is as quick as with the native cable.  Realize, however, you will need a USB wall plug that is able to put out the enough current (e.g. 2.1 to 3 amps) in order to take advantage of quick charging.  (If your wall plug has too low a current, you device will charge but not as quickly.)  Transfer appears to be quite quick as well, although I had no specific way to measure it.  The cord does not become warm during use normal use, it has not harmed any of my equipment, and has not started a fire.Recommended.
title: An excellent second cable for your USB Type-C devices

text: It is, as named and labelled, a basic USB Type C to USB A cable. If ordered directly from the A-Z store, you can rest assured that unlike cables that are supposed to be from a big fruit named company (as an example) this cable wouldn't be a counterfeit.  Sadly, many of the cables that come from other brands are cloned/copied and counterfeited and sold here and being certain that you are getting a cable that is guaranteed to work and not damage your device is a major concern. text: This basic USB A-to-C cable is meant to charge newer devices (with a reversible type C connector) from PCs, older chargers, and general-purpose USB ports.Unfortunately this cable fails the "check-R" app, indicating it lacks the correct resistor(s) to limit power draw from older charging sources. The lack of correct resistance most seriously can result in equipment damage, and usually also means unreliable (variable) charge rates. Out-of-spec cables have been a major issue for USB-C adoption. For details, search for "Benson Leung", a google engineer who has been systematically testing USB-C cables (and maintains a USB-C FAQ on google+).I love the AmazonBasics label, which provides an inexpensive go-to for general-use products including cables. Unfortunately, their supplier for this cable seems to suffer from the same issues as many other generic USB A-to-C cables. Since it is apparently out of spec, Not Recommended.
title: fails check-R, out of spec
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 5, 2017

text: Though ‘basic’, it is nevertheless the best combination of value to money offered on this site.  Sure, you have probably scrolled through countless cables with gimmicks like ‘tough braiding’, designs, and colors, but now you can just stop – this is the cable you need.The Amazon Basics USB-A-to-USB-C is a cable that extends the interoperability within the USB standard.  With a common USB-A (the ubiquitous rectangle computer port plug) with the newer USB-C (the newer rounder plug), you can combine your combination of old and new USB devices during this slow technological transition to everything USB-C.  Inevitably, you will encounter something with a USB-C port, and you do NOT have either the port or an additional cable to use it.  While the immediate benefits were in achieving the fastest transfer speeds capable my external drives would allow, it has also extended the life of older computers.  Save yourself the inconvenience of not having the correct cable – or enough of them – by buying this cable right now
title: Yes, It’s an USB-A to USB-C Cable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 1, 2021

Tutti ci guadagnano. Anch'io perché ne avevo la necessità e l'ho avuto nei tempi che mi aspettavo.
title: IN UN LAMPO

text: Ho acquistato questo cavo di ricarica USB Type-C a USB-A 2.0 maschio e devo dire che mi ha soddisfatto appieno. La confezione contiene un cavo di 0.9 m di colore bianco, che si adatta perfettamente alla mia esigenza di caricare e alimentare dispositivi dotati di porta USB di tipo C.La compatibilità con numerosi dispositivi come MacBook, Chromebook Pixel, Galaxy Note 7 e molti altri, lo rende molto versatile. Inoltre, è possibile utilizzarlo anche per la sincronizzazione dei dati, delle foto e della musica.Le prestazioni sono ottime, infatti, il cavo consente di ottenere una velocità di trasferimento dati fino a 480 Mbps e una potenza in uscita fino a 15W (5 V, 3 A), senza superare il carico consigliato.L'aspetto che ho apprezzato di più è la facilità di inserimento del connettore di tipo C in qualsiasi dispositivo, grazie alla sua flessibilità. Inoltre, la certificazione USB 2.0 garantisce la conformità dello standard USB 2.0 certificato da USB-IF.In conclusione, questo cavo di ricarica USB Type-C a USB-A 2.0 maschio è un prodotto di qualità, versatile e dalle ottime prestazioni, che consiglio senza dubbio a chiunque cerchi un cavo affidabile e facile da utilizzare.
title: Cavo che fa il cavo

text: Pros-1. Its always advisable to use the charger and the cable which comes with your phone. All manufacturers have the same advice. But there are cases where your in-the-box cable has either gone bad or is too short. In such cases first preference will be to buy a longer charging cable from the same manufacturer (in most cases is not available) but the second preference would be to use AmazonBasics type C cable. You ask why?2. Well As compared to other "good" brands which carry a 6 month warranty on charger and cable, AmazonBasics Carries a 1 year warranty - this is lesser known and even lesser advertised assurance.3. Let's say you manage to buy a branded charging cable which does offer you 1 year warranty, try claiming the warranty and you will soon realize how tedious the entire procedure is to get a replacement. Visit a nearby service centre, get your receipt and all the stories to let you down. In frustration, you would rather go and buy a new cable! Unlike this, I have experienced that one my type C charging cable from amazonbasics wasn't charging after around 10months. This is where you get to witness Amazon's superior hassle free service. You just call amazon and inform them of the issue, and a replacement is sent - no questions asked. The older cable can be given to the person who comes for delivery (no original box needed as well). Is there any brand which provides such a stellar service? I don't think so! Hence this is my #1 reason to recommend amazonbasics type c charging cable than any other brand! I wonder why others who have provided a very negative review have not exercised this 1 year warranty claim?4. The other good aspect of amazonbasics type C is (tried and tested) it works seamlessly with my Samsung S8 and A8+. No issues with fast / quick charging ! Some cables may come cheaper but beware that there is more to the wire "inside" than just the looks and the cost! You may end up destroying the circuitry of your premium phone in the bargain if you compromise on the charging cable or charger.5. As with fast charging, it Also does fast data transfer!6. I recommend a longer cable than the default size which comes with the phone since its easy to connect to a nearby port and sit on your chair or sofa and keep using the phone. Always use a slightly longer cable than what you need to ensure that the cable does not stretch at its joint and ultimately peels off. Many reviews and photos of this can be evidenced!Cons-1. A nylon braided cable would have been preferred if such an option would have been available, though I know its slightly expensive. Non braided cables tend to tangle, the longer they are unless you have purchased separately an accessory (wire clip - check pic) to tie the cable in place for storage.**Warning -This is a type A USB to type C USB cable (see pic), so if you have a Type C to Type C USB cable for your google phone, then this is not for you!
title: Best quality, Best priced Type C cable

text: Me quedé muy sorprendido, primeramente por el hecho de sentir los cables muy duraderos. El color blanco a mi parecer es más bonito que los normales en negro, además por el super ofertón que aproveché al pagar $186 pesos por CINCO cables de 1.8 metros cada uno no me puedo quejar de ninguna maneral.Uno lo uso en el auto para aprovechar Android Auto y el otro con el cargador original de Samsung para usar el Wireless Charger Duo y cero problemas. Lo intenté usar con otro USB C que tenía y no me permitía cargar, pero con estos de Amazon el problema se resolvió. No hay más que decir, la longitud es fantástica aunque a veces estorba estar enrollándolo en el auto porque sólo uso una parte cuando respondo algún mensaje bien dice el dicho que más vale que sobre y no que falte.Muchas veces ha usado mi copiloto el cel y obviamente no nos preocupamos porque el cable se estire o se desconecte y ahí es donde resulta muy útil. He flasheado un par de veces una Note 10+ y últimamente un S20+ y aunque recomiendan usar siempre el cable original usando este de AmazonBasics no hubo nada de problema. Te transmite seguridad que el grosor del cable es muy bueno y también rápido piensas que te va a durar mucho, lo cual he comprobado en esos seis meses que llevo usando apenas dos de los cinco.
title: Espectaculares
location_and_date: Reviewed in Mexico 🇲🇽 on August 10, 2020

text: I needed some more usb type-c cables as I got a new Samsung Galaxy S10 and wanted some longer cables and some spares.With AmazonBasics stuff you know what you're getting is going to be quality and that if anything goes wrong Amazon will be more than happy to sort it out in speedy and efficient fashion.Thankfully, this cable has been great and I haven't had any problems at all. I've only had it a few weeks so wouldn't want to comment on durability but it seems very sturdy and I hope it will go the distance. I've bought way to many "official" cables off eBay and Amazon in the past for very low prices and inevitably after a little while you have to mess around or stand your phone up at a funny angle to get them to work at all.I have been using this cable with an official Samsung fast charger and it has worked brilliantly. I have been able to charge my phone from low battery to full in a little over an hour which is great. I have also used it with a Samsung wireless fast charge dock which seems to be a little slower but still does the job in a very quick time, and you've got that extra wireless element to it.All in all a great cable... I have trusted AmazonBasics stuff in the past and it has not let me down. It isn't always the cheapest but is always reasonably priced. If it's something I'm going to be using on occasion I will maybe take a chance on a random brand but for something like this which will have daily use AmazonBasics is an easy choice! Highly recommended!Thanks for reading my review, I hope it was helpful in some way!
title: Fantastic cable! Recommended!

text: So  i have 5 or more other cables exactly the same that do NOT work with my main 4 devices, devices being, playstation 5 controller, samsung charger for tablet s7 and also phone, and also, a ssd storage drive I use for music. And THIS cable, works for all those things !! Im nkt 100% sure about the data transfer date, but basically, I was having to use my ssd hard drive cable for my ps5 controller, and for my tablet because those just didnt last. Or, i have 1 that only works with my ps5 controller. But yeah, if u need a very long usb c cable, amazon jave you covered! Only took 7 days to deliver. And its so long! 2.7 metres? Way more than i expected 😂 So, if you need a cable that works. For the price u cannot beat it! If you can, it probably wont work on all devices. Its weird, usb c cables can be a bit hit or miss. Sorry for the long review, but i like when stuff just works. Enjoy your purchase! Im personally buying another 1 in black if they still have them. Can recommend it! 5 stars!

text: Io ho acquistato il modello “AmazonBasics - Cavo USB da maschio USB Type-C a USB-A 2.0, 0.9 metri, colore bianco codice Asin B01GGKYLW0.Il cavo è lungo 90 cm, ed è compatibile con lo standard USB-A 2.0 – USB Type-C. Il cavo funziona sia per la funzione di ricarica di corrente dello smartphone da caricabatterie e da porta USB del PC, e sia per la funzione di trasferimento dati da PC da porta USB. Il logo di certificazione USB è presente ed è stampato nelle plastiche di rivestimento delle prese USB di inserzione. Il cavo non è in tessuto intrecciato, ma rivestito in plastica. È made in China.Esiste, a qualche euro in più, una nuova versione più performante nel trasferimento dati con standard USB Type-C a USB-A 3.1, per chi avesse differenti esigenze.Per chi semplicemente come me aveva bisogno di un cavo funzionante e compatibile per ricaricare lo smartphone da caricabatterie è consigliato. Saluti.

text: This Amazon basics cable 1.8m white is decent as it achieved the main purpose I wanted it for. I needed a longer cable to charge my mobile with its original fast charger. I tried other USB C cables ive already got but it would not let the fast charger do na fast charge only a slow charge. Dont know why this is - some cables allow it and some dont. But this Amazon basics one will enable the fast charger to fast charge with the longer length allowing me to sit comfortably on the sofa whilst its plugged in charging. With the original cable that came with my phone it was onky 1m long and I has to twist round at an uncomfortable angle on the sofa as the phone would only reach so far. But now Im happy.One criticism is that I think it should be less expensive being as it is meant to be an Amazon bascics item, but the quality is good.Thanks for reading,Milesfb.

text: Brief:Good build quality.Can go through daily wear and tear without giving up.Above average charging power.Here's the deal,Iv bought around 3-4 cables from different vendors all claiming to be sturdy and durable and having wire wounded cables which they claim to not give up on charging your device all of a sudden one day, but the truth is, I had to buy another, and another until I bought this one. It's only been a month, but so far it's been the best one to handle the kind of messed up charging habit and environment I put it through. I use my phone while charging, while laying on the bed and I move around, alot. Given all that, it still has not given up. Which means that it's internals are pretty well made. Solidly built.And given than most of the type C cables that I bought are within the same price range or slightly less,this is, so far the best. And there should be a reason why this cable has been mentioned among the best of top type c cable reviews across the web and for quite sometime.

text: Ho preso questo cavo USB Type-C a USB-A 2.0, 1.8 metri, colore bianco solo a scopo ricarica per il telefono di mio marito, non mi serviva quindi una versione superiore alla 2.0. Prezzo trovato molto conveniente, 5.91€ a aprile 2019, quindi davvero un'ottima occasione.Il cavo è arrivato integro, perfetto, arrotolato dentro la sua scatolina.Esternamente alla confezione, un'etichetta ne descrive il contenuto e la fabbricazione (Prodotto in Cina).Provandolo a scopo ricarica dico subito che si tratta di un cavo di tutto rispetto, mi sembra anche più robusto dell"originale. Il connettore entra perfettamente, è facile da inserire e si aggancia bene (insomma il click si sente quando entra e ricarica perfettamente).Come velocità di trasferimento dati immagino che una versione superiore potrebbe far meglio (la 2.0 ha velocità di trasferimento massima di 480 Mb/s) ma, per le mie necessità, basta e avanza.In sintesi, cavo perfetto per le mie esigenze di ricarica cellulare, lunghezza per 1,8 m, robusto e flessibile. Rapporto qualità - prezzo ottimo...e poi, come sempre, vuoi mettere la comodità di una consegna a casa in 24 ore!? Ciao!

text: Lo primero que nos gustó fue su longitud.... interesante!!! Francamente se agradece esa longitud. Lo segundo es su grosor, muy práctico en ese sentido. Conexiones firmes que esperamos no se aflojen o dejen de dar sujeción adecuada. Por el momento debemos de permitir que pase más tiempo. Pero lo usaremos sin estirar el cable, sólo conectar y desconectar tomando el cuerpo de los conectores C y USB. Hemos comprobado su función de carga y es óptima. Aún no hemos pasado los datos, al parecer no es útil para importar archivos fotográficos a una laptop. Es extraño porque lo ofrecen como un cable con esa función. Si alguien puede aclarar al respecto, bienvenido su comentario. Por el momento es nuestra reseña....después que transcurra más tiempo podremos abundar en su calidad y utilidad.

text: I bought this cable for my LeTv 1S Eco which used to go into boot loop whenever I plugged it into my OEM charger. I thought my phone was at fault, my fake "OnePlus" cable that I got for cheap didn't support fast charge, thus leaving me with pathetic slow charging options. My stock cable used to charge my phone fine with a 1.5A Samsung charger until a day ago when my phone to boot loop again. Now, my PC won't recognize my phone anymore and upon fiddling my phone was shut down. I saw this cable on lightning sale. I bought it with closed eyes thinking even if it's my faulty phone, I can use it in future.To my surprise, it worked. I was overwhelmed.QUALITYThe USB-C port has the right dimensions, unlike cheap cables. I can feel the click. The Wire is not very thick but the quality is good, feels like some expensive OEM cable. I can use my phone while charging without having to worry about it getting snapped out. I'm not sure about its longevity, but it should last longer than those cheap knock-offs.FAST-CHARGINGIt works flawlessly, may be it is a certified cable (need to check that). My phone went 18 to 85 percent in approx. 45 minutes before the trickle charging kicked in.DATA SYNC:I could sync my files between phone and PC without any issues.I bought it off Amazon prime sale, it was delivered to me after 15 hours.Thank you Amazon!
title: Don't waste your money on cheap USB-C Cables
location_and_date: Reviewed in India 🇮🇳 on August 26, 2017

text: Il cavo funziona bene, sia in ricarica che in scambio dati, ideale come cavo di scorta da tenere sempre nello zaino da usare per emergenze e viaggi. Ma se ve ne serve uno per uso quotidiano e avete la possibilità di spendere un poco di più, vi consiglio assolutamente altro. In primis, la porta USB-A è in standard 2.0, e non 3.1 come l'ultimo uscito. Questo si traduce in una minore velocità nello scambio dati in caso si colleghi il dispositivo ad un computer, la velocità di ricarica invece rimane la medesima. Secondo, per qualità del cavo in sé. Non è in tessuto intrecciato, quindi risulta meno robusto rispetto a tali varianti. Ne consiglio l'acquisto solo a chi vuole risparmiare il massimo per avere una dotazione di cavetteria da "backup" per quelli che usa regolarmente, altrimenti vi conviene optare per un cavo USB-C USB-A ma a standard 3.1 e in tessuto così da guadagnarci in performance e robustezza. Spero di esservi stato utile, a presto!
title: Questa è la vecchia versione, consiglio la nuova

text: HHKB Professional HYBRID Type-SにはUSB Type-A（オス）とType-C（オス）の純正ケーブルが付属していないため、PCを有線接続するために購入しました。PFUから発売されている純正ケーブルは1.8mで2,750円（税込）と非常に高額でしたが、こちらはPFUの純正ケーブルの約1/3の価格であることとUSB-IF認証を取得している、加えて中華製の安全性、耐久性に疑問がある安物ケーブルなんかよりはるかに信用できると思ったためです。他のレビューにも書かれているとおり、ケーブルカバーは同価格帯かそれより上の他社製品と比較すると硬さと太さがありますが、携帯電話などを充電するといった目的で持ち歩く必要がなければこれで十分だと思います。充電速度や安定性についてはこのケーブルを使える端末を利用していないので評価は不能ですが、HHKBへの給電については今のところトラブルは発生しておりません。また、予期せぬ充電ケーブルの破損や故障時の予備としての購入も価格や信頼性の面で推奨できる商品です。
title: PFU HHKB Professional HYBRID Type-Sに利用

text: Cable USB Type "C" a USB "A" 2.0 AmazonBasics, 180 centímetros en color Negro._Características:La presentación es simple, una caja de cartón y en su interior el cable.Mide 186 centímetros de punta a punta de conectores, tiene un peso de 42 gramos y un grosor de 3,2mm.Por un lado tenemos un conector Tipo Usb "C" y por el otro un conector Usb "A" 2.0._Usos:Transferencia de datos y carga de Smartphones._Conclusiones:En mi caso es "Válido" para carga (no rápida) y transferencia de datos en Moto Z, Zuk Z1 y Z2.Es fino , parece "resistente" y por tamaño puedo decir que me sobra, de todas formas hay que tener muy claro que es "limitado" por que es Usb 2.0._Pros:Transmisión de Datos y carga.Conector Type "C"._Contras:Usb 2.0.Durabilidad a largo plazo no contrastada.Saludos By Flype
